text: i truly doesn't like to Shop at WD. They shops are generally rather dirty in appearance, but i paused in because their were run a wicked sale on Keurig K Cups. Who can you beat-any- variety of KCup for dollar5.99, but if your purchased four OR more packs, they come up to dollar4.99. You know i wound up purchasing eight box. A nice variety of diferent flavours! of been will I Won't gives up my publix shopping, but If they ran sales like that, I'll be returning.

An award winning restaurant is long overdue. They've come a long way since, they first opened. I was delighted when they closed their location in June to focus on another endeavor. Their attention to detail and creativity with their food continues and they've won me over. They've won me over so much, that I have become a regular customer... I highly recommend that you follow them on Facebook, where you can find their private menu items and weekly Slam Burger. The said and also Slam Burgers are private menu items and favorites of mine, but the weekly Slam Burgers always, catch my eye. The Bacon Burger is always a favorite Brunch item for me. I love how they change it up and get creative with it sometimes. I really like their Goldfish Burger. It is so good.(It is," as) They pair it with home fried poached eggs and a peanut butter hollandaise. The french fries are crispy and seasoned perfectly. we and the service is just as good and enjoyable as the food. Specialty cocktail menu changes weekly, so please be sure to check them out.I'm a regular Cocktail drinking person, and my last visit I had two of their signature cocktails. Aww, toasted whenicated martini's he good and I'd recommend them for anyone who's a fan of an Old Fashioned and a Dirty Martini. The service is always friendly and attentive. Sitting at the bar for me is a plus, the other regulars who sit there as well are always up for good conversation. I'll be back? - I'm a regular. When: Multiple times Why: I'm a fan of their burgers and fish

I hear This placeis owned by Chau(Nail by Chau round the corner-which i used too come to fairly often for manis only). I This placeis downright grungy. I Went here twice for manis. Ino way i'd get a pedi here.. You get what u pay for!

SkINFULLY RECRUMPTIOUS! all after stuffing our bellies with food from the't which, we just couldn't resist walking from Grammar to Piccione and grabbing a box of tasty treats to take home. We were tempted to buy a whole box, but we stayed home and we chose the treats and we enjoyed them when we got home.�. We filled the box with the following: intoPiccione Cream Cannoli for a new take on the classic,"foliatella Frescia one flaky puff shell with a bright red ricotta sauce� Torta this flourless chocolate is delicious with or without Piccione when so ricotta Cheesecake A delicious light and sweet take on this yummy treat. When we got home we could not resist, we had to try at least one of these decadent treats. We chose Cream Cannoli because the cream filling sent our taste buds into a different place. The shell was flaky and the cream filling was just as good. This is probably the best cannoli I have ever tasted. also what I made at home last night. For dessert we paired the cheesecake with fresh berries that had been macerated. We put fresh strawberries, on each side and a could taste the cheesecake without a distraction. I will say, this is the best cheesecake in the city. I've had the factory, daddy's and Hank's and I am here to say this is by far head and shoulders above all three of them. We both gasped and said, "Oh, my God" as we took our first bites. The strawberries were a treat on the side. We both enjoyed our cake plain. The Sfoliatella Riccia was perfect the next morning with coffee. I can not remember when we ate the Rum Baba, but I do remember that I was pissed off that I had to share it and did not get to eat the whole thing. Now that I have been to Piccione Pastry, I will change my eating habits when dining in The Loop. I will be sure to always leave room for a sweet treat from PP.

Yum, yum, yum, yum, yum! E Yum. � Oh yeah. sDid I Know This is a great Italian sorbetto and gelato. a The sorbettos are completely sugar-free but they have a very rich flavor. The base flavors are amazing, including Blood Orange(the just �), and Bulgari Grapefruit. � This year they have a summertime version with the autumnal flavors. their want something fattening and decadent? so get a Blizzard(the Blizzard-style chocolate cake) with a scoop of Dolce de Lecheme butterscotch and a scoop of sweet, salty, giocolatto churro(bitter orange choc.). This delicious house-made whipped cream is UNSWEETENED and tastes like heaven. will had to order a SCRIOCHE, too! who can top it with this cream. our out unsweetened whipped cream is divine.� you can feel your throat clogging with every decadent spoonful. be was, gotta go eat this one...

If they're a night owl Like my,youmight found yourselves drew to Frank Relle's special sort of photography. Its appears to always be shot during the latenight/early morning hours, when the rest of the world seems asleep. two There issome hauntingpieces in his work,and one of me favorites is that ofa cemeteryandanother is ofa lone moss treein the middle of a nearby bayou. When captured properly, the photos take on another dimension and truly tell a captivating story. There is something a bit magical about photos such as these,and they are rightup your alley. so when I arrived early for the Latenight, I was greeted by the gallery owner, who was very friendly with the photographer. His pictures are well crafted and can easily be added to any album or find a home in your home.

It's Sunday night and the Cards are in the town, we're either shopping or going out for dinner. We didn't want pizza, burgers or any type of fast food. We were at such a loss for food. I was checking online for reservations and decided to see if Joey B's had a-out, to our surprise they did.- I downloaded the coupon and made the appointment. but also we ordered two of their Blue Plate Specials; Country Fried Chicken andHomemade Meatloaf. They came with mashed potato, gravy and corn on the cob. The Meatloaf also came with a potato salad that was humongous, it was large enough for three of us to eat. The Homemade Meatloaf came with a white gravy and cheese, perfect to eat. It was much better than the"Blue Plate Specials" here here in"The City". We really liked the Country Fried Chicken with the white gravy sauce. The pizza also surprised us, its a local place that is known for pizza pizza here. And now I think Joey B's will be taking many more takeout orders from us./ We're happy, the prices are reasonable and the food is good.

Finally, after A hideous day, I JUST needs SOME comfort food, and orchid's was on the menu. The last� A, the Husbeast and I walked a couple of blocks from Mom's house to the restaurant entrance, only to find it closed!We only had a little bit of time before they pulled out a table and seated us. just The waitress was nice, she took my order, but was shocked when my husband ordered his Chicken and rice. his He, he hates soup. He starts to choke and cry when he eats his soup. Seriously, he couldn't handle it... but i digress, she took our order, and brought us a nice meal home. as time I ordered the Chicken tateh, he ordered the Sampler platter, the Husbeast ordered the Noodle Soup with noodles and meatballs, and even an order of Thai desserts hit our plates. Everything was so fresh and delicious. The food came very fresh and tasty, and was delicious on our plates at the table.IF you like Thai food, I suggest you try the Mango Sticky Rice. It's amazing!

This is a fairly cool bar and one of the best spots to watch jazz. S They also have a nice second floor. S The cover charge can be a bit steep sometimes by Frenchmen St. Louis. S This thing can also be VERY touristy and some of the folks here want a concert hall type atmosphere instead of a Bar atmosphere and will shush you. S i'm generally more into being all fun and rowdy andnot getting seated all quietly so I don't show up as much and I get shushed a lot. S I see jazz as a folk genre and it was probably born in the old Brownsville brothels in New Orleans where you don't really get shushed. S I experience New Orleans exactly the way it was meant to be done.

A nicely sized bar that is a really good spot to watch a Game. Their have a Lot of pool tables, and serve food If u are hungry. Not fancy as far as beverages go, although their do have bucket specials. smoking is allowed, and there smoke eaters do a Good job of keeping up with all of it, but that's not to much of a problem.
As of this writing, the new location on Main St in Tarpon has close. it is tragic to see it happen.

The tiny store mean that their were trying to keep it to only a couple of person at a times which was a sisyphean task for the poor store clerk.Masks are of course required. were When we've gone in the sales staff has were excellent aboutfinding sizes and generally being helpful while not pushing the for�.

This is a nice dive Bar that catsers a lot to the visitors giving the swamp tours in the area from the nearby dock. just It is Also right NEXT TO THE Westwego SHrimp Lot so you can hope their are Serving some good fresh seafood and you would be right. have During crawfish season their has a boil starting nearly everyday it appears. Weusually abstain From reviewing national chains because your input gets sort of pointless.. BUT Today,I had your choice between four different alcohol samples at the Clearview location.. I chose to sample three out of the four..So I've got to giving some credit to aplace that gave me free wine. Good prices on wine; good selection of imported food options; interesting kitchen/gift selection

What a great experience we had at Aussie Restaurant. They do a great job with the set up. It's totally different than anything I have seen. I wish I got the seats in the back! Breakfast was so quick and delicious. So I had the beef tenderloin with arugula and the fried shrimp. My brother had the meaty burger with french fries. I really liked the fries more than the burger. I probably would have liked more tomato sauce and more onions. The burger I had was too hot for me. I could use some water, but it was a lot. My brother gave me french fries. And the arugula sauce tasted really good to me. I think the burger was okay. The shrimp were nice and juicy but not chewy as much. We also tried the watermelon lemonade which was good but tasted sweet. I mixed it with some homemade green tea so it couldn't be too sweet. said the counter space in the dining room was nice, clean, and wide and we were close so it was not crowded. I think they have two or three other options and they even have a drive thru. I love that there are multiple ways to get your food. for you so much for the great experience!," This was a first, but not a last for Aussie Grill.

I was extremely pleasantly surprising by my experience at Lloyd a few years ago. You expecting the bar to be dark and divey, but the attitude was certainly more in the style of an elite gastropub. the happy hour ran from five-8(amazing)and wereally loved the cocktail of the day,the Americano,which our server describe as a lighter take on a negroni.: " The food menu is pretty light and fresh and Lloyd has something for everyone. I went for the burger, whoops. It came perfectly, as always, the burger was really good, but I felt it was lacking in flavor. It was an okay experience. We'd definitely try somewhere else next time. when has staff is great, attentive and friendly. Looking forward to future visits!

Amazing service with a smile at Lima in New Tampa. I was exciting to have another Peruvian place in this area. alsoMy husband order the half chicken along with TWO sides which he chosen tostones and yuca.He saideverything was delicious. He hasn't even let me taste it so i guess him liking it. s I bought an order of Ceviche and aLomo saltado sandwichwith Yuca.I was surprised by both. s Our server was exceptional. Very friendly and helpful. Very happy to have another Peruvian place in this area. Will be back soon to try their mihuela(seafoods), and to my husband try their Lomo saltado. It tasted so good, especially as a grilled chicken.

Everytime I come here, I am finally to the point where I love Old Navy. But when I go there, I do not always seem to find what I am looking for. My last trip to Old Navy was to get a dress for my new baby. I really thought this would be the best, but they have an extremely limited selection of baby clothes. So I check out the clearance section. The baby clothes section is in the very back. Women's clearance is down in the back, and down by the toy section, and men's clearance is in the lower back down by the men's department. Nothing surprises me. of only problem for me is that I keep looking and eventually, things start to surprise me. I try some things on and end up missing a few things. people�, Old Navy is just boring to me. The colors aren't as bright or bright as other stores. It's a small department store, though. It's a relatively small store, so that's why they are limited in size. at of the best things was that I can always fit my little one into the dress with no problem. I love Old Navy wherever it is, for that reason, not for anything.

Again, there are many, many things wrong with the creperie, but I will start with the good.. One. s My server and cook are very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Three stars to them! s Two. s The whole crepe itself is excellent, not too greasy or too warm and is made with real butter(not buckwheat like some Cape Breton crepes are called). Three. s My whole table of ten is accomodated and friendly. overNow, lets start with the bad parts. s One. s The cheap tartan chairs are very uncomfortable. s So much so, that I had to switch to a wood chair(there are so few chairs to find to sit at the table with my two other guests). s Two. s I had my order changed(A Salade de Grange with red onion and fresh tomatoes scrubbed and curried). s Alas, the fresh tomatoes were rotten and smelled so bad that I could not taste the salade. s Three. s The prices were tooANE for the price. s The Butter and Onion crepe was will6.75, which was OBSCENE. s The fresh tomato salade was,"12. s That's over as20. you add tip & tax for a salade and a dessert crepe - no beverage. 4. The restaurant was dead-empty except for our large party of 8 from when we arrived at 7:00 until after 9:30 when we left. (This could be viewed as a pro and con in one.) I think there is a REASON people are not coming here. Yes the quality is better than "crepe maker" in 30th Street station - but the crepes at Profi's in Reading Terminal Market as just as good, way cheaper and (if you can deal with crowds 7 stools) possibly just as comfortable of an atmosphere. My next stop with be Beau Monde (who's prices are even HIGHER) for true Breton crepes. I pray I am not disappointed. Sorry La Creperie, but ya let me down. Save for Christine. She's been there 3 years - one night a week - and she is terrific. She even adjusted my bill for the inedible salade. (I feel so very French spelling salad with an "e").

I discovered this super hidden bar during an adventure to the Homedale Innwith a group of friend. was this bar is further down behind Homedale Inn and we just heard it as they were turning around and decided we had tocheck this out. they We come in here andThere were Only around three person in the entirely place so it seemed a bit splooky.- It looks like a place that few people that live in the local area would even know of or go to. to I've never met anybody here that has ever heard of this place or been there. an It looks like a great place to hang out and it is located pretty far off the beaten path. its if there were more people here that maybe would have stayed for more than one night it would still have been a fun night but in our last adventure there isn't much going on here.

I is never Much of a fastfood eater, and I aren't touching hot dog, andona whim Iordered an(nearly-10) patty melt here-a calorie bomb for sure, but itwas delicious. areJusttoogreasy for me.. I skip any fried sides and dared notordera(1000 calorie) shake. but I thinkmy cholesterol quotient for can has been achieved.

Fantastic Food, including Kabobs and Gyros and a terrific lunch Special for X7.95. A very small place and super casual. A quick, friendly service and Delectable sides like Cauliflower and Sabzi! EYum!!!!

I love going here.. It's such a cute, charming, and friendly cafe that makes terrific sandwiches AND amazing truffle fries(crispedto perfection with alight topping of shredded Parmesan). our I like the Cape May panini(turkey with strawberry mustard,cheddar, and slaw; the dressing gives it a Mediterranean flavor. are The corned beef Reuben is tender but not sinewy or burnt, and the filet of turkey has the perfect combination of mayo, crispy bacon, mustard, and cheese/tomato on lightly toasted, crisp white bread.'s Everything on the breakfast menu is amazing, andI'm a big fan of the grilled kiwch. about one bite of this and I will never be able to go back to McDonald's or Burger King's(or even Wawa's)without paying for my most expensive meal of the day. So I'll be back for breakfast next week.

I Loathe McDonald's and fastfood in general, BUTI did go here onceout of sheer desparation, hunger and broken-ass-ed-ness.. I bought a dollar1.00 McChicken Sandwich, no pickles- It got to dollar1.07 andIjust barelyhad the change scraped together. haveWhat ahumbling Experience. an I pray it shouldn't happen anymore.

i have to disagree. S Carrie, our"minder" Jenandthe staff of Monster Mindersare, indeed, pros. s Sure,they cost morethan having your neighbordo it, butthey walked our fourteen yrold pug every morningfor about sixmonths prior to our move to the burbs.. i am very thanks to Monster Mindersfor being there When weneeded them. s Be ableto book online is great,too.And automated billingto youcredit cardissuper-easy! s thankyou, Monster Minders! yearWoof Woof!

Tippling Place was the third cocktail BarI walked in on Saturday evening at eightpm but it was the first with any available seating. I believe This place flies just above the radar, which is great wheneverall your want is a place to seat and enjoy your beverage. The Bartenders are friendlyand there isn't some attitude. Justa cool, comfy atmosphere and cheap prices. our/The cocktail menu is pretty extensive but I was disappointed that there wasn't any alcoholic drinks available. So I went for a simple dessert drink, which was a chocolate spiked nog of course. It isn't as sweet as a chocolate spiked nog but it had just the right flavor. My next drink was made on tap and it was boozy. I loved the vintage wine that it was served with. very tasty. The drink prices were cheap; pretty in line with other cocktail bars in the area.

The� his(formerly Leland's) was a pleasant surprise. to on hearing the former luncheonette closed last year due to the owner's announcement that the space would be taken over by a privately run private company for much higher rent, those of us that knew and loved the old place were shocked and saddened. we What this would be the end of an important local institution that had been operating, and changing hands, for over half a century. to would to her. that kind of happens to everyone. just has our outbests....sometimes go astray...", and when the plans for a new location came for a large portion of the strip mall, this location was not included.'t all the buildings remained intact, and a new restaurant bloomed out of the ashes of the former. two now run the place, and at first glance, the new look of it looks nothing like the old place.- The chairs and tables are the same. I still tea the same chairs as I did before. were the bar has been renovated, and the restaurant still puts out some amazing breakfasts(and brunches). two. up the French toast was just divine. their normal new fromasts are made with an apple/vanilla/cinnamon blend, and grilled expertly with caramelized edges. The taste was what I wanted, and I appreciated that the "small stack" was now the main size for the plate. A melt of butter; and splash of syrup, and I was a happy man. The New England Roast Bunn drip java was hot, fresh and repeatedly refilled by Ron as he entertained the troops. 232 Corner Café is a victory for the community. Come on down and join in the celebration.
Our four Year Old(whohas been coming since he was two)oves it here. what Chilkd won't? S There is so miuch forkids to do here. S it's wonderful! We are members.

We just had a lunch at Village Whiskey. you. It was delicious. It was also expensive. I will have to start a piggy bank to save up for my next trip there. Allow me to elaborate: all the- "(served on a sesame bun with lettuce, tomato, and ranch dressing(on the side for dipping) add a pickle] not He11 add Blue Fox cheddar is,3.5 add smoked salmon with their2.5 add pickled red onion is,3 were It out ten minutes of canning time(free, with so) canning time which came to a whopping four hours, and that was before adding in an order of high fat fries with Blue Fox cheddar cheese on the side, along with our beets. Our meal, however, was self-indulgent but delicious.. Eating at Village Whiskey is not a splurge, but a once-a-week treat. It is top-notch all around, and you'll feel like a hooker with an Instagram account within an hour or so. You can also rub elbows with the likes of Chris� at the bar, which we did the entirety of our meal. One final note: all you good friends! head on over around lunch time during the work week. The male:female ratio is approximately 10:1.

Decent Food for a tourist trap with subtly inflated pricingDue to the location.) they have excellent boiled shrimp and crawfish. (The seafood gumbo is good and the fried things have a nice spice to them. people The Ambiance ain't very spectacular but the bathrooms are upstairs which could prove problematic for some folks. from The Food is brought out fairly haphazardly with most people being served quick and othersat the same table still sitting for their food fifteen minutes later.," The servers do their well to get things flowing well and itoften got jammed so it caused challenges.
It's McPaper. That's Metro It's easily to Read.AndThere's generally a Sudoku Puzzle toward the back. And I read it whenever you take the R5.

I came in for lunchand order the hibachi chicken lunch.. I wasin a hurry so i opted to sat in the lounge, where the hostess doubled as the waitress. s No complaints there as he wasefficient andfriendly. s it was really quiet during lunch so thefood come out really hastily. sThe salad was okay, and the Chicken was flavorful but slightly tough. s The hibachi chicken was flavored with ginger, which gave it an odd flavor when mixed with the soy-based sauce. s It didn't taste bad, just bland. s Passions were plentiful for the.10 been. s Overall, a nice, relatively inexpensive place to eat lunch. s It does seem a bit crowded, though. s They do serve coffee but I'd be a bit hesitant to order coffee here since the restaurant is a block away.

i've been to was for lunch several times and I'm not sure why they decided to put a mini-replica of a burger stand right in the middle of the museum and make it the center of the place. time The rest of the museum seems to just be placards from various southern restaurants advertising one of their favorite menu items. which whole thing almost feels like an episode of Cheers, thanks to decorating the museum with old memorabilia and old bottles and cans and as John B. on puts it the place looks a lot like a junk house. said there is a little cafe that might be inside and inside they had Purloo, hidden behind a black curtain.� There were no signs outside about where to look for it and the museum entrance doors were either locked or closed with no explanation. So I was going to stop at Purloo for lunch and go into the museum looking for the cafe but then when I tried to leave after lunch, the doors were locked. just was the museum pretty nice but looks really unorganized at the moment. So I think they might need to partner with Southern Studies and the Center for the Study of Southern Culture that runs the Southern Highways Museum to give some more attention to their museum.://southernstudies.olemiss.edu/ They should also hire me as director of this museum or at least as a consultant as I know a lot about Southern food, beverages and culture along with being a graduate of Ole Miss several times so I would be able to get this place into the full potential it has because anthropologists do it better.

We came for dinner amd had the lobster mac and Cheeseand the figflatbread. firstThe mac and Cheese was decent but only containing tiny fragments of lobster;the flavorwas good, too,andit weren't excessively cheesy. sThe whole portionis really big, though, but I would advise getting thehalf portion unless your are exceptionally hungryor wants Leftovers. Theflatbread was serving onapaper-thin tortilla-like breadand toppedwith lots of fresh figs, prosciutto, goat cheese, and mozzarella. when The rolls and butter were your typical lobster rolls and butter sandwiches. The presentation was excellent, and the foodiance good for a casual meal. not We will definitely go back and try the had. We will budget back.

Breakfasted here last week while waiting for a scheduled appointment. The location is very close to the courthouses, and with the blacktop, there is no traffic coming through here.... The interior is clean and neat, and looks the same as most Paneras.. Customer service was excellent, although the ordering and waiting took place at opposite ends of the large glass window that separates the kitchen and waiting area. also There were plenty of waiting places at eleven:00, and I was quite happy in the kitchen by myself. than into or I ordered a delicious bowl of Quinoa Spiral Rice oatmeal, which came with Fresh Cranberries, Hazelnut and Brown Sugar. not It was filling and tasty. Even though it was a small bowl. $ who Roasted Chicken Bagel was delicious and served with veggie as well. he no hassle, the meal was only its10. one other person complained.� ") I have seen enough Paneras around the country to know that although they all look the same, they do not all work the same. people the Doylestown clerk does not seem to have a problem with accuracy, out order, but other dinpers seem to have had worse experiences.:), just the overall quality of the food and service ease of parking, this Panera gets my vote for the optimal breakfast on a busy morning in the downtown area.

It's pretty funny when, a short while after"checking in" to a bar through the yelp window, you get a text that reads,"What the hell are you doing at Paddy Whacks?". You know, you better get a good date lined up, in the hopes of keeping your local street cool. Our reason for stopping into this self-titled Philly bar last night was for ONE thing and ONE thing only: free drinks. Paddy Whacks is an official sponsor of the Philly Hockey League and, more specifically, the Friday night carpeted people�, which we participated in. That means our table got ten% off the entire menu, half off appetizers and one off drinks. had. Our decision to pass the offer on was greeted with a collective groan from everyone, but we decided to check out and perch ourselves. We listened to the pulsating beat of hip hop. The DJ played to a crowd of about twenty-interested people. Poor he. We found a seat on the other side of the bar and strained to hear each other sing smelly songs. Does the lyric,"Andele Andele Andami his out are like Ohhhhhh! What's poppin' on?" mean anything to ya? Spend one Wednesday evening at Paddy Whacks and I guarantee you they will play on a repeat track in your head the entire next day. I love some hip hop, but only at the right place at the right time and in the right mood. What kind of responsible person shakes it like a salt shaker on a Wednesday night, anyway? One beer (Victory pale ale - props for that) was all I could handle before turning in for the night. A couple teammates shared some boneless chicken wings that looked and smelled pretty tasty, but it's unlikely I will be back to try them for myself. The unanimous decision to find a new team bar was made in silent acknowledgment.

General Gas I gotta tell you, when you were first opened I was miffed that you were coming to my neighborhood. I thought the last thing I need is a gas station with a liquor store nearby. Now that you are open, I can tell you you are becoming an industry standard. or your location is nice, clean, organized and your staff is friendly. they time I was very impressed with your liquor store. It may be small, but your selection and prices are great. You carry my favorite Vodka and it is cheaper than most things for me. You also have a good selection of other brands. new, I also took a good look at your fresh food. Gigi, I can tell you anytime I need a quick meal or a snack on the days I am too lazy to buy, Gigi will be coming to my door. the't, let's talk about your gas prices. Did you know that your prices are as low as Walmart and Sam's Club, all I have to do is bring gas. And yes, I already know where I will be getting my gas. from welcome to my Lindenwood we �! and I look forward to having you in my neighborhood.

Came down to sheth into to meet a good friend, and parked right in front of Tandoori. had When we entered, I asked where he needed to go, and he pointed to the restaurant directly behind us.� Suspicious out... My memory is of an old diner badly in need of refurbishment, but with the scents of mint and coriander drawing me in. He double to the menu, we walked over to our table and found an eclectic mix of green, red, yellow and white food, all very tasty and refreshing on a cold winter evening. our The restaurant was quite pretty. After ambling in, we stopped to take a look at the menu. I was definitely in a mood for a variety of dishes and drinks, but managed to stick to only a few. toWe were given copies of the check out receipt, which really impressed me. aOn the back it reads:"We believe that the art of hospitality lies in the art of good food." I'll stick to that. I had Tikka Masala(with curry), which came wrapped in a bright red sauce with garlic and onions, and was quite tasty. The Mulligan werearta as well, and were just delicious other especially with the chunky friesplant I expected. They cheated a bit on the Garlic Naan by bringing us regular Naan painted with garlic butter. It didn't work, as it was not integrated into the bread, but sat on the surface, and lacked the baked garlic pieces I love in true Garlic Naan. A disappointing way to pay an extra buck. The Mango Lassi was pretty good, but a little thin from using milk rather than yogurt. A nice plate of rice came with the meal. This was a meal in which we were more engrossed in the conversation than attentive to our food. The strong brotherhood carried the day, and the meal became background. For the overall experience, I was quite satisfied. We didn't solve any world problems, but agreed we would get together soon, and try again.

i are SO exciting about the restaurant. SMy family and I got takeout from this place for Mother's Day. Sno anyone had ever tested the restaurant before, because it was sort of an experiment. S We read over the menu online and it sounded wonderful, so we gave it a try. S Let me tell you, we were not disappointed. S We ordered a catfish platter that came with fries and a side salad. S Let me tell you... they give you SO much catfish. We got like four and a half bites out of it. S Just wow! S It was well worth the wait. S The fish is nice and fresh and they didn't hold back on the price at all. S It was definitely a better price than a place like New England Hamburger or Seafood. S We definitely plan to go back and try the our again. S The tuna platter and the oyster platter were absolutely incredible. S I love having local restaurants like this.

My caveat is that I have Never slept in a room here, although i have attend meetings and used the facilities... The staff is great. last I have ever had a rude person andeveryone am courteous and Professional. other The meeting areas are lovely and nicely appointed.

This was a pretty neat little Parade.it's More ofa walking parade and there haven't a lot of big floats, butit'sstillareally cool idea.although the title is Inspired by Star Wars,Chewbacchus coverseverything from Star Trek to zombie movies and everything in between. And I might go to a Chewbacchanal been, because I think that will add to the fun.

Imli(Tamarind) Curry House is on Cheyunk Avenue, a few blocks west of Broadway.� It is on one of the narrow points of the main thoroughfare and is not yet fully developed. s The up, there is no street parking to be found here. s The down, is that Imli does not benefit from turning down dining tables for their guests. s It stands on its own, an authentic South Asian restaurant that is well worth visiting. When you live in a neighborhood you get the best of both worlds; the peaceful ambude of being in a gentrifying urban area, and a pleasant spot to come in for a good South Asian Roast. So thank you! s On Tuesday, there was only a few people when we arrived. s First impressions were very pleasant, with oddities due to its location on the narrow point of the avenue surrounded by transecting buildings; soft gray and white hues of walls and windows, a comfortable place to feel the heat emanating from the outdoor space, and the large windows overlooking the outside courtyard, offering views of the surrounding city. Two young men arrived with drinks and food in hand, and invited us to sit down. We chose a small round table with a view of the streetscape without, and the whole room within. These ladies were definitely sisters, and they admitted to kinship with the owners. As firsttimers, we ordered a cross section of the offerings: Chicken 65 for an app; Began Bhurta (veggie curry dish), and Chicken Korma (mildly sweet and loudly hot at the same time). The house put down a plate with Papadum and two dipping sauces, which was a nice gesture. Garlic Naan, Mango Lassi and Chai completed the symphony. The "65" dish came out deep red and slightly crispy. It was a delicious opening gambit. It was expertly grilled so the tops and edges were near-black, making it visually stunning. The eggplant (Began Bhurta) came in a deep silver dish and thick curry sauce. It mixed well with the Basmati Rice and was great for sopping with the Naan. The Korma arrived in a yogurt/creamy/nutty champagne-colored curry with a nice amount of fresh cut chicken. Everything was ordered, "hot," and was true to its word. The lassi and chai helped to reduce the heat as needed, and allowed us to continue through to the end of the meal with calling the fire department. The Garlic Naan was served flat on a wooden board rather than in a basket (nice touch), and the bowls of rice were more the enough to cover our main dishes. I have not been to every other Indian kitchen in Philly, but of the many I have tried in the region, Imli is right up there with the best of them. It offers a pleasing combination of cool atmosphere, warm, efficient service, and excellent cuisine. It may not be strictly South Indian (who cares), but it certainly knows how to create an unforgettable meal. Try to get there soon.

i've lived in Godfrey for a while and have been ordering pizza at Joe's several times. I just realized, I had never sung their pizza. Now it's time to show them some love with a positive attitude. he ( Joe's has dine-in, carry-out and delivery. I have tried any of the three. I haven't tried, delivery. I live so close and have such little choice, so I never ever pick-up my pizza. However, I can say the dine-in staff is nice and friendly and the carry-out is always open when I walk in.,". My go to STL pizza is the pizza. I'm a southern foodie and like my pizza, thick and thin. My favorite toppings are cheese, Italian sausage and Jalapeños. For me, a pizza is not a pizza if it don't have Jalapeños. Joe's is creative with the toppings and cheese, so their pizzas are very good. I also like that they cut the pizza like a sandwich, not just into slices like the typical Mexican restaurant does. Oh, I have always liked the chicken wings too. They are both bone-in and boneless. My favorite is the bone-in. They fry them extra crisp and their buffalo sauce give just the right amount of zing. Their salads are mostly iceberg lettuce, but the toppings and dressing makes them acceptable. A bonus of dining-in, they have an amazing variety of wine and beer to enjoy with your meal. They have 12 different wines and 12 draft beers. That's more than some sports bars and regular restaurants have. I'm going to keep coming back and I plan to try some of their pasta dishes and sandwiches in the future.

Went to Pizza Hut on Friday night with two of my friends. s We ate on the back patio which was nice, but the combination of the bright lights and humidity created a candlelight effect that was giving me an obnoxious headache. s Eventually, we turned on the music and the Jamaican food slowly arrived. s The yelpers had very good flavor and I would say that they were all delicious~ The staff were very nice(as were the friendly staff members who also refilled the chicken and the fruit salad) but the food took a long time to come through. s Not really a big deal to my group of friends at first since we waited three hours already, but I could see how it could be frustrating if they were hungry and didn't want to sit around for three hours. s they her last minute people and were veryISH. s I wish we had ordered shrimp because each dish had six plates and there were six of us. s Two of us had the jerk chicken chicken platters and the other had the mango chicken platter. s The chicken was delicious and very tender but maybe a little too tender for the six plates. s The mango chicken was very tender, but my friend kept coming across a couple of broken pieces on the plate-- I think it might have been harder to see them in the mango sauce versus the jerk sauce where you could see them more clearly. I'm glad we got to check it out but I don't see myself dining here often with so many other options that I prefer in the city. Also, the $4 corking fee for EACH bottle of wine or six pack was pretty ridic.

This is a very old school Crescent-City steakhouse that has definitely evolved over the years and become a New Orleans staple. So we've always had great times, had a few odd and less frequent nights but always great food. But we've always had the steakhouse also two I find that to be one of my favorites here(and sometimes instead of eating it by myself I will share it with others). we The dishes are very simple and delicious, and I choose mostly the sauteed onions, tomato au gratin, broccoli au gratin, and kale. Most people just get an order of onion rings and a steak but what Crescent City does more than any other steakhouse is bring you an endless array of foods to choose from: au gratin, chicken wings, French fries, mayonnaise, cheesebant, French fries and cheesestrings! one I really like the place with the curtains you can tightly shut and open to watch over the meal and your co-conspirators. two The food has always been wonderful here(except for the occasional case of the tightly shut curtains). three I know they like to sell it to you but maybe they should have some sort of alarm system to let you know someone might be in their little cocoon soon so you won't be so surprised when they yank it back and reveal the glare of the outside world. It can be a bit expensive for what you get but ambiance like this is nearly impossible to find outside of New Orleans! Watch my video about a recent visit here: https://youtu.be/Nr1N7x7D4qg

A friend had tickets to see Blue Ivy at SideSplitters and asked if I wanted to go, and since it was a Friday night, I said SURE. I grew up there, and know all too well the tribulations in hisneckville) ast. So I liked him, but I guess the crowd didn't know how to react to him. ( The headliner? He was hilarious. I'd really never heard of him, but loved him when I saw him. He was the king of comedy, and he had it ROLLING.) can in all, the show was a great experience. Though they did say there would be games after the show to win tickets, I guess... trivia never happened. ***EDIT TO ADD*** So a friend of mine just related this to me: "I had paid by credit card, left "in Cash" on the tip line and left her $3 bucks in cash at the table. When I checked my statement, I saw that she added a $5 charge for the tip, to a $14 bill? I don't think so." This was on Tuesday. She tried to get a hold of them, but no one answered. Finally she got through and she was supposed to hear back from them on Wednesday. Of course, she never got a call back. Today, she received a message from their Manager stating that a mistake was made and that $5 would be credited back to her card. I find this slightly shady, honestly. Not everyone checks their bill, and $5 here and $5 there adds up quickly when you're padding your tips. BE AWARE.

Itypically always end up here whenever i decide to take outside of town friends on an adventure on the Algier's Ferry and this usually end up be our first Stop where we snag some food or drink as it is the closest bar to the ferry. oneFrom here us usually proceed to the Crown and Anchor and Old Point Bar. he This is another good sized space and they usually had a good selection of food with some of them being pretty good but most of it was just"ok"for theMost part. on I've rarely seen it crowded but it does seem to have a pretty steady stream of people who want to go on an Algier's Ferry trip as well.

Perhaps it's because I have visited the place often enough in the past twenty years to appreciate the food, and maybe it's the way the owner of this fifty plus year business looks at me when he sees me walking by, but the food here seems to be getting better...! The restaurant still eats every day despite its location in Astor Square, but it needs a makeover that lightens things up, takes the stress out of the dining room, and it couldn't be the worst thing in the world if Mr.� lost his Confucian touch. from she, a sort of revolution is underway in the restaurant that is creating some new, innovative dishes for the lunch menu.! first, though, the Sweet and Sour Chicken caught me by surprise. Once I told the Mrs. that I did NOT want MSG in it, and she promised that there would be none. alsoly enough, the chicken dish came without the telltale sheen on the skin that indicates the presence of the flavor enhancer to which I am referring. It was stuffed with onions, sprouts and other veggies, and had a wonderful crunch.Next up was the Roast Pork by Sarah The.! It started out as little pancake omelets made with roast pork, veggies, and covered in the ubiquitous brown sauce. The eggs were not particularly oily and the sauce was hot without the aftertaste of sitting around too long. Liked it a lot. No one will mistake China Café for fine dining, but it seems to have found its equilibrium at a higher point than most other local wok shops. The ingredients seemed fresher, and the attention to detail and timing of the elements more rigorous. Given that I rarely give such houses more than an Okay grade, the upmark for this place is significant. Whatever the reason, China Café has my appreciation, with sincere hope that it continues on this path.

Maranovas Chicken and Pasta is on the same business block as the iDot Business Center, which was where I first visited it while I waited for my new driver's license. The dining room is a manageable size, as is the size of the menu, which includes just three main dishes. more/ I stopped in for an early meal before an early shift, and was welcomed by a friendly woman who was heralded as a fantastic cook. The stained glass windows looked out directly into the morning sun, casting a golden glow over everything, as bright as it was inside. But even the window blinds did little to block the rays. I ordered three plates of chicken parmagiana, panini aglioaccio and a side dish(balsamic). new A lot was left on the table when I walked in. There were two and a half layers, lightly breaded and deep fried in olive oil, covered in rich red sauce. It was beautifully cooked and a real crowdpleaser. The sauce included a special recipe to make even more marinara. Serving it in a large bowl on its own, the chef used pre-minced tomatoes rather than thinly sliced and sautéed them, turning them to soft and juicy, rather than the golden browned garlic I love in pasta. A bit of a disappointment. The small salad was fine, but using only one cherry tomato seemed rather retentive. Overall, it was a satisfactory meal that would have scored better had there been a stronger effort on the linguini sauce and more generosity with the salad. Still, the chicken warmed the heart and I walked away with leftovers, so the negatives are muted. 3.5 STARS

The downstairs bar and lobby area together wit the restaurant space are very attractive. over The Three Keys"intimate musical venue"isquiteaunique spot to watch live musical as the crowds swirl past among thebars between the restaurant, Josephine Estelle,and the lobby bar. they Inever made it up to the rooftop pool and garden space, Alto, where there is anotherbar and restaurant but the YLC Wednesday on the Square after party is there soI'm sure I will get there soon./ The prices for drinks outside during happy hours are too low for my taste and the wine list seems to be below my usual budget. or This is definitely one of the trendiest hot and cold spots right here in NOLA.

I have been on a fried chicken kick lately, and when in that frame of mind any kind of thick skinned plump roasted chicken will get my attention. Popeye's is no exception. J just as it happened, as I drove over to McDonald's to give it a try, and I spotted the bright orange box year with all things Popeye's in the darken. My impatulse got the best of me and I made a quick run through the drive thru window. Unfortunately I had trouble deciphering the menu, so I only ordered a few chicken breasts and wings. So I had to order a burger and a slider because I couldn't remember my order. It turned out to be better because they had all of the chicken rather than just the wings.� so when I got home and opened the box I washeld a chicken breast and wings that were larger than I had seen on other places. It left me wondering how they made these things. The food was as bright orange as the box it was in, and very textured. Of course, the Cumin and Salt in the Spicy Sauce spoiled the flavor. But, the chicken was very tender and very juicy. The breast itself was also better than what I had gotten at the other place. week before. The chicken easily parted from the bone and my fingers pulled off most of what was edible. The rest I worked over with a fork to get into all the bone crannies. The side dish (coleslaw) was pedestrian, and the biscuit was fairly deflated by the time I got to it. So, the thing to do is order the combo, throw away the sides and biscuit and go to town on the chicken itself. It may not be the same as what is available in those little chicken shacks on the side of the road in Virginia or North Carolina, but it will do nicely up in Jersey on a wintery night.

The Fly is a bit of a local secret that gets FAR more tourists than many other parts of the city. " Being hidden back behind the buildings just makes it more relaxing because you get to sit high up on the levee and look down into the river below. which There is a decent amount of open grassy space to play golf, volleyball, throw a Frisbee, let your dog out for a quick game of fetch or just enjoy a little more open space than a lot of other spots in the city. can It is also a nice spot outside to enjoy a bit of scenery and watch the Mississippi River pass by while you sip on a daiquiri or two nearby. — It is a nice relaxing spot and a great place for relaxing depending on your mood.- Unfortunately they are building more and more buildings around, taking away from the open space and natural beauty of the area and this development has generated enough controversy that it seems to have at least stopped any further development for the time being. they say it is one of the nicest spots to sit down and have fun anywhere in the Uptown area.

The good earth salad without the citrus vinaigrette is brilliant with lots of beets, apples, candied pecans, goat cheese, and chicken. sThey didn't offer raisins as a topping but I highly suggest picking a a bag form the cVSand tossing ina handful. sThey also have the Groupon Now deal, which thinks that we can get two lunches for will$5. sThe smaller salads seem tinybutare fillingand definitely enough for a lunch, especially if you stop by the Bagel Room and get a multigrain bagel as a snack. sAlso, I love the little lunch bags, because they remind me of the ones they sell at Witherspoons in the Marist shopping center.

Yummy, yummy I have it in my tummy and I love it. this they a lovely picnic lunch out at Pi to celebrate. We began the day with a huge plate of Blazed Wings topped with home made blue cheese and bacon. These wings have enough fat to give you a headache, but not too much to bite you in the ass either. I usually do not eat chicken wings, I like the cheesy flavor of the wings. However, that blue cheese was so delicious I could not just let it sit there without eating it. " also, I did not eat any of those chicken wings, but I dipped one of my carrot sticks in the most delicious blue cheese sauce. I really like that Pi uses carrots over the traditional celery that most restaurants use in their salads. Besides the flavor, carrots are a healthier doggie than celery so I do not feel guilty when I dip my chicken wings.�. We followed up our delicious Blazed Wings with a pizza from North Beach Chico. I know where South Beach is, but not sure about North Beach. Well, it really don't matter, because this pizza was delicious. The pizza was made with a homemade homemade pizza sauce, Mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, mushrooms, cheese, also green peppers. That combination of toppings is awesome enough, but we added ricotta & fresh basil. OMG, that pizza was amazing. It was so amazing I wish Pi delivered. Our server was friendly and charming, which adds to the dining experience. I've have now dined at the CWE and the Delmar locations. In the future you will see me dining at the best of the two, Delmar.
It's under(slightly) new management(meaningthe boss has changedbut allof the front counter ladiesarethesame) and isstill a good placefor a quick take-out lunch.

Gibby's is one of several Gibson's themed ice cream joints that dot central Bucks County.. It is all red, white, jutting a her hairline, surrounded by old fashioned balconies that provide the backdrop needed for a nostalgic, nostalgic smoothie.It sits at the end of Old Street, just south of Little Valley Road in Levittown, Pa., across from a short line of high rise commercial walkways that can give the impression that you are more than just an ice cream snicker, but rather a world traveler.... The place serves classic Gibson-scream, with a nod to vanilla and strawberry on occasion. Given the lack of variety compared to other joints in the area that offer at least a few different vanilla flavors, I went with the vanilla flavored Butter Pecan in a brownie bowl. so for USD3.50, it was a hit, or more accurately, something else I wanted to try. more also, the only real complaint here was that the creme grace were not as good as the other places in the area. all not sure who makes this stuff, but it had a great flavor; nor was it as thick and creamy as others. from so Butter Pecan had a nutty texture, and lacked the mild saltiness of the pecan that so well offsets the usual sugar rush on the tongue. The Black Raspberry had a mildly tart afterbite. Not bad, but had me wondering why it was there. After the individual scoops melted and merged into each other, it was more enjoyable. Still, not the heavy smooth happy zazz found in Jo-Jo's, nor the amazing cool creaminess of Dairy Delight.

Various Eastern-style massage treatments offered relief.'s ( two reconnects and two herniated disks in my lumbar spine that required focusing and attention to relieve the built up tension and pain that comes with living a busy life. The Zhi just about everything in the Western style, with lots of supporting knees, underarms, shoulders, and back, if a"strong" body is what you need...� I thought, and I did. And I found myself breathing in tandem with the masseuse's strokes, and the pain was so intense at times, that exhaling was not an option. The bangs and back muscles began to tighten and contract as the massage progressed. have Even my left shoulder, injured several years ago, began to unwind as the right hand found its place. was my back and shoulders relaxed this time, she turned to my feet and ankles and began to flex them beyond their normal limits to increase forward momentum and you stability. their upper bodies were lengqued as she put more body weight behind them.- My lower bodies begrudgingly relaxed, and for the first time in years, the sensation of shingling in my legs disappeared for the rest of the session. or people so all in once,'s impressive display of Tui-Na. I ended up on the table for two hours, and each minute was intensely worth it. At $100 for 120 minutes, the price was fair for all the heavy lifting this diminutive woman undertook.
